document.text:
From: 
'• 
To: Edward Friedland 
Cc: Jose Matthew Rogers 
Subject: RE: Maxwell Link 
Date: Mon, 29 Nov 2021 18:04:41 +0000 
Inline-Images: image001.jpg 
Joe, Ed, here's what we're ready to post, unless you have any correction: 
November 29, 2021 
Victim Attendance at Trial in United States v.  Ghislaine Maxwell 
In orders dated October 14 and November 24, 2021, the S.D.N.Y. Court outlined procedures for 
public access to the trial in this matter. (Trial began on November 29, 2021, with jury selection.) 
Specifically, consistent with the District's COVID-19 protocols, the Court will ensure public access 
(with COVID-I9 distancing) to the trial in the courtroom itself and in several overflow rooms at the 
courthouse with live feeds of the proceedings. Beyond the live feeds within the courthouse, the trial 
will not be further broadcast; nor will there be any telephonic dial-in to the proceedings. Victim access 
will be coordinated by the U.S. Attorney's Office Victim-Witness Coordinator,  
), and Mr. Jose h Pecorino of the Court's District Executive 
Office .  Victims who wish to attend the trial 
may contact either one of those persons for further infonnation. 
COVID-I9 Protocols. Per the S.D.N.Y. Response to COVID-I9, anyone who appears at any 
S.D.N.Y. courthouse must complete a questionnaire on the date of the proceeding prior to entering 
the courthouse. All visitors must also have their temperature taken when they arrive at the 
courthouse. Only persons who meet the entry requirements established by the questionnaire and 
whose temperatures are below 100.4 degrees will be allowed to enter the courthouse. All visitors 
must wear a mask that covers the person's nose and mouth. Bandannas, gaiters, and masks with 
valves are not permitted. If a person does not have an approved mask, a screener will provide one. 
Anyone who fails to comply with the COVID-19 protocols that have been adopted by the Court 
will be required to leave the courthouse. There are no exceptions. For more information, please 
see https://www.nysd. uscourts.gov/covid- 1 9-coronav irus. 
From: Edward Friedland 
Sent: Monday, November 29, 2021 12:01 PM 
To: >; 
Cc: Joseph Pecorino Matthew 
Rogers 
Subject: FW: Maxwell Link 
This info on your web page is outdated and is causing the public to try and access the Maxwell matter by phone. Can you 
pull down the access number info and update with the latest order which says in-person? 
Edward A. Friedland, Esq. 
District Court Executive 
United States District Court 
EFTA00015654

Southern District of New York 
From: Joseph Pecorino 
Sent: Monday, November 29, 2021 11:57 AM 
To: Edward Friedland 
Subject: Maxwell Link 
https://www.justice.gov/usao-sdny/united-states-v-ghislaine-maxwell 
Joseph Pecorino 
Office of the District Executive 
United States District Court 
Southern District of New York 
Email: 
Office: 
PLEASE CONSIDER THE ENVIRONMENT BEFORE PRINTING THIS E-MAIL 
EFTA00015655
